intro: Sedum pampaninii, commonly known as the Canary Island stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the Canary Islands. It features fleshy, upright stems and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy leaves. It thrives in well-draining soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements make it a valuable addition to drought-tolerant landscapes.
